intro: Notholaena interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted fern, is a member of the Dryopteridaceae family and is native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb with a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread through vegetative growth. The plant has pinnately compound leaves with a distinctive interrupted pattern, giving it its common name. Its fronds are typically dark green and have a leathery texture. Notholaena interrupta thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
